channel.title: Wooooot!
channel.description: Now i will finally see how is famous 'talking to da brick' looking :)

item.title: Wooooot!
item.dc:creator: @Asm Asm
item.description:
@Asm wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:11, topic:25387”][quote author=Asm link=topic=38200.msg462647#msg462647 date=1163595029]
about importing: there are no item images in RS cahce files
only 3D models
RS cache code is quite complicated (i still do not understand it completely), thus for private clients it is better to load additional/another resources from ordinary files, not runescape cache.
[/quote]the textures and sprites are stored in the data files… he meant importing java packages[/quote]
usually i’m too lazy to write ‘import’ keywords manuallly

Read full topic

item.title: Wooooot!
item.dc:creator: @Asm Asm
item.description:
@Asm wrote:

done
here is the solution:

[code]try {
java.util.Iterator iter = javax.imageio.ImageIO.getImageWritersBySuffix(“png”);
javax.imageio.ImageWriter iw = (javax.imageio.ImageWriter) iter.next();

        RandomAccessFile ss = new RandomAccessFile("c:\\windows\\items\\" + id + ".png", "rw");
        javax.imageio.stream.FileImageOutputStream out = new javax.imageio.stream.FileImageOutputStream(ss);

        iw.setOutput(out);

        DataBufferInt databufferint = new DataBufferInt(imagePlain.data, imagePlain.data.length);
        DirectColorModel directcolormodel = new DirectColorModel(32, 0xff0000, 65280, 255);
        java.awt.image.WritableRaster writableraster = java.awt.image.Raster.createWritableRaster(directcolormodel.createCompatibleSampleModel(imagePlain.width, imagePlain.height), databufferint, null);
        iw.write(new BufferedImage(directcolormodel, writableraster, false, new Hashtable()));
        ss.close();
        iw.dispose();
    } catch (Exception ex) {
        ex.printStackTrace();
    }[/code]

May be there is better way, but i don’t know it

Read full topic
